name: TheAtlantic
text: "The Supreme Court has transformed constitutional provisions for fighting racial segregation into instruments that preserve it," @LeahLitman writes: https://t.co/abpXJt3FGt

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Trump campaign's ‚Äúelection-security operation‚Äù is a key element of the president's closing strategy‚Äîand its capacity to wreak havoc next week could be significant, @mckaycoppins writes. https://t.co/9m5hSiSsvl

name: TheAtlantic
text: Endings are seductive. They suggest order, and resolution, and relief. But they don‚Äôt always suggest the world as it is. @megangarber on the conundrum of ‚ÄúElection Night‚Äù: https://t.co/Ga7xzNM2ZJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: If Trump tries to steal the election, people will surely protest. But stopping a coup requires more strategy, @JudithShulevitz writes. https://t.co/1gre0OYfOJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: He‚Äôs assailed democratic norms, but the president is lauded in parts of Asia for his hawkishness toward China, @TMcLaughlin3 explains: https://t.co/IpBt4hamAG

name: TheAtlantic
text: A former Detroit cop makes a living on YouTube filming America's worst neighborhoods. @clickclaimprize reports: https://t.co/QVKfmmg969

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Ponyo." "Julie & Julia." "Unstoppable." "Addams Family Values." Everyone has their own list of "comfort movies," but @davidlsims turns to these 25 genre-spanning films again and again: https://t.co/DlLUOnnAVF

name: TheAtlantic
text: As thousands die on his watch, the president is severing any lingering ties to scientific reality. @jameshamblin on the ominous implications: https://t.co/7kbXcQ9vBZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The lack of universal coverage has made the U.S. more vulnerable to Trump‚Äôs demagogic appeals," @TimothyDSnyder writes: https://t.co/ZzqVeVtGTt

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: "While Trump supporters see him as the driving force behind the change in U.S. policy toward Hong Kong, this ignores, experts told me, the reality of Beijing‚Äôs tightening hold on the city." https://t.co/dPPTvi7WDF

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: There is a "belief among some demonstrators that Republicans were decidedly more pro‚ÄìHong Kong than their Democrat counterparts, despite the fact that there was strong bipartisan support for the city in Washington." ‚Äî @TMclaughlin3 https://t.co/dPPTvi7WDF

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @PaulBisceglio: "To look on, inert, as Americans suffer and die is one thing; to deny that it is happening is another."

@jameshamblin on what Trump has become in these final weeks before the election: https://t.co/DvrcploiqE

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @mckaycoppins: Pro-Trump poll-watchers are set to fan out across battleground states in the coming days‚Äîsmartphones in hand‚Äîto hunt for evidence of voter fraud. Brace for a blizzard of misleading, out-of-context videos. 

My final story before the election: 

https://t.co/PeJ1MvLXye

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @jameshamblin: Trump has gone from downplaying the virus to fulminant denialism. He is no longer misunderstanding or ignoring scientists and doctors, but attacking them and making up conspiracies. I think this is an important, ominous shift to note. https://t.co/qegwR6yWHk

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TMclaughlin3: Many believe that Biden ‚Äúcould well sell out Hong Kong.‚Äù Spoke with Wan Chin and a few other Trump superfans about their unwavering support for the US President and the fear that a Biden presidency would mean ‚Äúeveryone should start learning Mandarin.‚Äù  https://t.co/bvrbrklf3f

text:

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: I recently reread one of R.L. Stine‚Äôs Fear Street books, and described the plot back to him in our interview. His response: ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs horrible. Who would write a thing like that for kids?‚Äù https://t.co/7Io4nLBgHQ

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @megangarber: "The sight of Trump shoulder-swiveling to 'YMCA' while entombed in his typical boxy suit sent me searching for Susan Sontag‚Äôs definitive 1964 treatise, 'Notes on Camp.'" @skornhaber on ... everything ... is so, so good: https://t.co/pQPch1EPjN
